channel.title: Riddim Yard
channel.description: <p><em>Riddim Yard</em><span style="font-family:tahoma,verdana,arial,helvetica,bitstream vera sans,sans-serif; font-size:12px"> is the home of foundation Jamaican music: Ska, Rocksteady, Deejay, Dub, Roots &amp; Dancehall </span><br><span style="font-family:tahoma,verdana,arial,helvetica,bitstream vera sans,sans-serif; font-size:12px"> </span><br><span style="font-family:tahoma,verdana,arial,helvetica,bitstream vera sans,sans-serif; font-size:12px">email: </span><a href="mailto:rick_howe@hotmail.com" rel="nofollow" style='color: rgb(204, 34, 41); text-decoration-line: none; font-weight: bold; font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, "Bitstream Vera Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 12px;' target="_blank">rickhowe@riddimyard.com.au</a></p>

item.title: We Have Survived
item.description: <p>Celebrating NAIDOC week with the outstanding new dub album produced by Monkey Marc ft. Walpiri elder Wanta Jampijinpa Pawu-Kurlpurlurnu. Plus an interview from the vaults with the Godfather of Australian Reggae: Mr Bart Willoughby from No Fixed Address.</p>
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Musically Bad - Aotearoa dancehall
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: RIP Owen Gray
item.description:
<p>A tribute to a founding voice in Jamaican music, Owen Gray RIP.</p>
<p>Plus something different from the new album Underground Oasis by the creative French reggae crew Stand High Patrol.</p>
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Lila Iké spreads love All Over The World
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Horace Andy’s Audition That Changed Everything
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Real Lovers Rock
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Treasure Self Love - Lila Iké's long awaited debut album
item.description: <p>Celebrating the release of Lila Iké's long awaited debut album <strong>Treasure Self Love</strong>. From the moment she arrived on the Jamaican scene in 2017, Lila has been the no1 artist on Riddim Yard: her voice, her honesty &amp; her vibes have kept her at the top ever since. Now, after years of anticipation, her debut album Treasure Self Love has finally arrived. Out now on Ineffeable Records!</p>
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Crown & Country
item.description: <p>This week on Riddim Yard we're joined in the studio by Wanta Jampijinpa Pawu and producer Monkey Marc to talk about their powerful new project <em>Crown and Country</em>. Bringing together Warlpiri philosophy, intergenerational song, and hypnotic dub-infused soundscapes, the work translates profound desert knowledge into music and film. At its heart is Wanta’s vision for Australians to embrace a shared heritage of Country, carried on the strength of ceremony, family and deep creative partnership.</p>
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: You Know GOAT
item.description:
<p>The prolific Worl' Boss <strong>Vybz Kartel</strong> releases another album Heart &amp; Soul, and <strong>Jahvillani </strong>delivers another cash-minded anthem for the hustlers: <em>Rich Like Bank.</em> Plus <strong>Chronic Law</strong> teams up with <strong>Rane Son</strong> for <em>One Law</em>.</p>
<p> </p>
item.author: Rick Howe

item.title: Al Campbell, The Slits, and Shatta Wale bring the pressure this week on Riddim Yard
item.author: Rick Howe
